name: NETXP LINUX Suspicious Network Commands used
description: Monitors suspicious network-related commands that may indicate unauthorized activities. This rule is designed to catch potential malicious network activities initiated by common tools such as wget, curl, netcat, and others. Detection of these commands could be indicative of network reconnaissance or data exfiltration attempts.
author: Szymon Gluch
query:
//any where auditd.log.key: "susp_activity" and 
any where event.module: "auditd"
